page.title: 04SOME OLD HOUSES IN THE AREA
page.content: Daniel lives in a mill which is 800 years old.It was bought four years ago as a ruin and turned into three houses.All have three floors.Our one has ground floor kitchen, dining room, utility room, hall, cloakroom and living room. The boiler for the oil central heating is in the kitchen. On the first floor are three bedrooms, a bathroom and study. The second floor has a huge room with a loft. There is half an acre of land with several trees and the Scarrow Beck at the bottom of the garden. Kate lives in a house that was once a Dame School and a garage. A man in the village remembers being taught there. The garage was owned by Shot Reynolds and the petrol tanks are still under the front garden. The Cooke family who once owned Aldborough Mill also lived in the house at some time.
